Conspiracy influencer Chantelle Baker films moment woman jumps on windshield in Rangiora as baby sleeps in back seat https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/conspiracy-influencer-chantelle-baker-films-moment-woman-jumps-on-windshield-as-infant-sleeps-in-back-seat/U4LJXB5CQZDIFJDPE3G4ZY7KS4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/conspiracy-influencer-chantelle-baker-films-moment-woman-jumps-on-windshield-as-infant-sleeps-in-back-seat/U4LJXB5CQZDIFJDPE3G4ZY7KS4/ Chantelle Baker claimed her 8-month-old baby was sleeping in the back seat. Sun, 07 Jul 2024 05:21:36 +0000 Influencer Chantelle Baker took video footage of a woman jumping on her car and smashing her windscreen in an alleged road rage incident in Canterbury on Saturday. Photo / Supplied
Police and family search for Chris a non-verbal Auckland man with Down syndrome, missing from Avondale https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-and-family-search-for-chris-a-non-verbal-auckland-man-with-down-syndrome-missing-from-avondale/J2BK3F76N5ALDO7Q7MQ6KNM5PU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-and-family-search-for-chris-a-non-verbal-auckland-man-with-down-syndrome-missing-from-avondale/J2BK3F76N5ALDO7Q7MQ6KNM5PU/ Police and Chris' family are concerned for his welfare. Sun, 07 Jul 2024 05:09:12 +0000 Chris was last seen wearing this maroon jumper.
Napier City Rovers into Chatham Cup quarter-finals for first time in five years https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/napier-city-rovers-into-chatham-cup-quarter-finals-for-first-time-in- Five-years/PELIIIY6SZHNZGN4USBOYAQMY4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/napier-city-rovers-into-chatham-cup-quarter-finals-for-first-time-in- Five-years/PELIIIY6SZHNZGN4USBOYAQMY4/ Doug LaingA former Rovers got one for the opposition, but the Rovers weren't lying down. Sun, 07 Jul 2024 04:56:07 +0000 Former Napier City Rovers player Andrew Bevin (centre) after putting Miramar Rangers up 1-0 in the first half of the fourth-round Chatham Cup tie at Bluewater Stadium, Napier, on Sunday. He’s congratulated by teammate Nicolas Bobadilla (No 20) but less can be said of Rovers defender James Hoyle (left), But it was all smiles later as the Napier side came back to win 2-1. Photo / Paul Taylor
